# The `PassRegistry` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passregistry">PassRegistry</a> - This class manages the registration and intitialization of the pass subsystem as application startup, and assists the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passmanager">PassManager</a> in resolving pass dependencies. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::PassRegistry</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passregistry">PassRegistry</a> - This class manages the registration and intitialization of the pass subsystem as application startup, and assists the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passmanager">PassManager</a> in resolving pass dependencies.

NOTE: <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passregistry">PassRegistry</a> is NOT thread-safe. If you want to use LLVM on multiple threads simultaneously, you will need to use a separate <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passregistry">PassRegistry</a> on each thread.

Definition at line 37 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/passregistry-h">PassRegistry.h</a>.

### registerPass() {#a1c6b1d7b3e51a4eeefbf90b25edaf708}

registerPass - <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> a pass (by means of its <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passinfo">PassInfo</a>) with the registry.
